articles.title: SPA of DPRK to Meet
articles.content:
SPA of DPRK to Meet
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The second session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK will be convened in Pyongyang on April 9, Juche 99 (2010).
					 A decision of the SPA Presidium on convening the session was promulgated on March 18.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Namibian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Namibian President
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Mar. 18 sent a message of greetings to Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of Namibia, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message noted that under the correct leadership of the South West Africa People's Organizational Party the Namibian people achieved the independence of the country through the protracted and hard-fought struggle and have made great progress in the work to build free and prosperous Namibia over the last two decades since its independence. The Korean people are rejoiced as over their own over the successes being made by the friendly Namibian people, it added.
					
					 Sincerely wishing the president and people of Namibia greater success in the work for the national unity and the rapid economic development, it expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation existing between the DPRK and Namibia would continue to grow stronger in several fields in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam to Visit African Countries
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam to Visit African Countries
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, will soon pay an official goodwill visit to Gabon, Senegal and Gambia.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Il
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Il
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of Kim Il, a revolutionary martyr, in the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong Saturday on the occasion of the centenary of his birth.
					 Seen standing before his bust was a wreath from General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Kim Yong Chun, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Kim Il Chol, Kim Ki Nam and Yang Hyong Sop and officials of party and armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, officers and men of the KPA, officials of organs in the city of Pyongyang and members of the bereaved family.
					
					 Placed before the bust were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, the DPRK Cabinet, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, ministries and national institutions and party and power organs and educational institutions in the city.
					
					 The participants in the ceremony paid silent tribute to Kim Il.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK-Russia Agreement on Cooperation Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK-Russia Agreement on Cooperation Marked
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A reception was given by the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Wednesday to mark the 61st anniversary of the conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Speeches were made at the reception.
					
					 DPRK Ambassador to Russia Kim Yong Jae said that the relations between the DPRK and Russia are favorably developing in various fields, expressing belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would be put on a new higher stage on the basis of the spirit of the joint documents agreed upon between the top leaders of the two countries and the treaties signed between the two countries and in line with the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK would make every possible effort for the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 A roving ambassador of the Russian Foreign Ministry said that the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the two countries signed 61 years ago is a document of great significance in the development of the bilateral relations, adding that there is potential strong enough to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between Russia and the DPRK as they have a long history and tradition.
					
					 The bilateral relations have briskly developed in recent years as evidenced by the mutual visits of high-ranking delegations and the implementation of a series of economic cooperation projects between the two countries, he said, expressing belief that this year would witness more substantial successes.
					
					 Receptions were given by the DPRK missions in Nakhodka and Khabarovsk of Russia on Mar. 12 and 17.

articles.title: New Feature Film Produced
articles.content:
New Feature Film Produced
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Korean April 25 Film Studio produced feature film "Here Is My Home Village".
					 The film deals with servicepersons of a company who are fulfilling their duty as the soldiers of the people, cherishing the noble intention of Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, and the slogan "Let Us Help the People!"
					
					 Through the portrayal of the commander and servicepersons of the company who love the farm village where they are stationed as their own native places and take care of the inhabitants as their own kinsmen, the film shows the idea that every part of the country over which the servicepersons stand guard is their native places.
					
					 The film impressively shows the noble ideological and moral traits of the servicepersons who have defended the socialist country as firm as an iron wall and demonstrated the honor of the revolutionary army in the general advance for a new great revolutionary surge, always remembering the request of the country and the people.

articles.title: Warmongers' Design for Invasion of DPRK Flayed
articles.content:
Warmongers' Design for Invasion of DPRK Flayed
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises staged by the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers defying the strong protest and denunciation of the Koreans and other peace-loving people of the world proved in practice that they are leaving no means untried to realize their wild ambition for invading the DPRK, says Minju Joson Saturday in a signed commentary.
					 The Key Resolve and Foal Eagle were very dangerous nuclear war exercises for invading the DPRK in the light of the armed forces involved and contents of their program, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers described the said war exercises as "defensive" and "annual" rehearsals. This was shameless sophism aimed at concealing the aggressive and provocative nature of the exercises for a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK and misleading the public opinion at home and abroad.
					
					 The above-said saber-rattling rendered the situation on the Korean Peninsula so tense that a war may break out any moment and further deteriorated the DPRK-U.S. relations and the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It was entirely thanks to the DPRK's war deterrent for self-defence that the military exercises did not go over to a total war.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will make every possible effort in the future, too, to defend peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers would be well advised to stop acting rashly, bearing in mind that they can never realize their scenario for invading the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Balderdash about N. Issue Dismissed
articles.content:
S. Korean Balderdash about N. Issue Dismissed
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, minister of "Unification" of south Korea, in a recent lecture, was vociferous about unstable peace on the Korean Peninsula. He talked nonsense that its main cause lies in the fact that the "nuclear issue of the north" remains unsettled and south Korea should be "a main player in leading the north to changes". Earlier, he went the lengths of admonishing the DPRK by asserting that the nuclear issue is a "problem directly related to reunification going beyond the conception of nonproliferation" and, therefore, the DPRK should "join" in the efforts of the international community for denuclearization if it hopes for reunification.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Those who are hell-bent on the moves to exterminate fellow countrymen with nukes of outsiders staged exercises for a nuclear war against the DPRK and are working hardest to lay the blame for the unstable situation at the door of the DPRK like a thief crying "Stop the thief!" This reminds one of a fox getting more furious, counting on a wolf.
					
					 What traitor Hyon uttered on the basis of his wrong view on reunification is nothing but sheer nonsense, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The reckless and provocative remarks made by the conservative group including Hyon over the nuclear issue are aimed at doing harm to the DPRK and isolating and stifling it.
					
					 The DPRK cannot but feel the bitterness of disillusion about the conservative ruling forces as they persist in treachery, far from joining hands with fellow countrymen to make efforts for national prosperity.
					
					 Their rhetoric about "being a main player" in doing something only provokes a side-splitting laughter.
					
					 They should bear in mind that there is no chance for them to involve themselves in any dialogue over the issue of the Korean Peninsula, much less playing the above-said role as they go reckless, unaware of where they stand.
					
					 Those who are keen to achieve their ulterior aim are bound to pay a dear price for it.

articles.title: S. Korea Tops World List of Importers of US-made Weapons
articles.content:
S. Korea Tops World List of Importers of US-made Weapons
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Institute of International Peace in Stockholm clarified in an annual report on Mar. 15 that south Korea topped the world list of importers of U.S.-made weapons from 2005 to 2009, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 It was reported that the U.S.-made weapons introduced by the south Korean puppet regime accounted for 66 percent of the weaponry purchased from overseas. 
					
					 This fact goes to prove that the puppet bellicose forces are keen on bolstering up their war equipment.

articles.title: Britons Protest against US-S. Korea Military Exercises
articles.content:
Britons Protest against US-S. Korea Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- British political parties and organizations staged a demonstration outside the U.S. and south Korean embassies in London on Monday in protest against Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises staged by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers.
					 Attending the demonstration were Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, Kevin Cain, organizational secretary of the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, and other personages of political parties and organizations and popular masses.
					
					 Dermot Hudson made a speech there.
					
					 He vehemently denounced the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises as a nuclear war game aimed at preemptive attack on the DPRK and a crime of threatening the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					 He called upon the British public to intensify the activities for checking the moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for aggression on the DPRK and defending its socialism.
					
					 Kevin Cain read out the report of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army and the statement of a spokesman for the KPA Panmunjom Mission.
					
					 The participants in the demonstration condemned the reckless war moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities, waving pennants of the DPRK and chanting slogans such as "Long Live the DPRK!" "Victory to the KPA!" and "Korea Is One!" with placards reading "U.S. Forces, Get Out of Korea" and "Down with the U.S. Imperialists" in their hands.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party issued a statement on Tuesday in denunciation of the said joint military exercises.

articles.title: Japans' Discrimination against Korean Schools under Fire
articles.content:
Japans' Discrimination against Korean Schools under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Japanese organizations strongly urged the authorities to include the Koreans schools in the tuition-free program for senior high schools. 
					 The Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a letter of protest to the Japanese chief executive reminded him that the right to equal education is stipulated in the Japan Constitution, demanding the government put all schools including Korean schools in the above-said program according to the bill on providing assistance to the senior high schools. 
					
					 The Society for Japan-Korea Friendship Promotion on March 4 sent a letter to an emergency meeting of Okinawa Prefecture urging the authorities to include Korean schools in Japan in the said program without discrimination. Noting that it is a foolish way of thinking to use the issue of education for achieving diplomatic and political purposes, the organization in the letter called on all Japanese to turn out in the actions against the moves to exclude the Korean schools from the program.
					
					 In another development, protests of Koreans in Japan against the Japanese authorities' unreasonable discrimination are being staged in various parts of Japan everyday.
					
					 Leading members of the Korean Youth League in Japan, the Korean Students Union in Japan, the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan and other organizations and teachers and students of Korean schools and compatriots conducted information service at major railway stations in Tokyo, Hokkaido, Kyoto and Osaka and 14 other areas on March 11 and 12 while personages concerned of Korean schools in Kinki area staged actions to urge the Diet to fairly handle the issue of assisting Korean schools. 
					
					Representatives of Koreans in Osaka visited the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology to present a written request and a paper containing signatures of more than 9,000 people to it on March 10 while representatives of Koreans in Kyoto conveyed to lawmakers a letter of request addressed to the Japanese prime minister and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology.
					
					  The managing director of the Korean Academy in Hyogo, principals of various schools, the representative of mothers and representatives of the civic organization for supporting schools in Hyogo called on lawmakers on March 11 and requested them to make efforts to find a solution to the issue of assisting the Korean schools with a proper understanding of national education.

articles.title: Ukrainian Groups for Study of Juche Idea Meet
articles.content:
Ukrainian Groups for Study of Juche Idea Meet
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the National Coordinating Committee of the Ukrainian Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Association for the Study of Songun Policy was held in Kiev on March 13.
					 Present there were members of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the "Sun of Juche" Association of Journalists and Men of Culture for the Study of Kimjongilism and personages of academic circles.
					
					 The meeting discussed the matter of significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun.
					
					 The committee set a commemoration period from March 13 to April 15 and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events highly lauding the greatness and the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung in the period.
					
					Then there was a seminar on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Having a Correct Understanding of Nationalism".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Denmark
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Denmark
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was brought out in booklet by the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association.
					 The work, published on Sept. 5, Juche 97 (2008), stresses that the DPRK's history of six decades is that of gigantic struggle and victory and great creation and changes in which its people have defended the independence and honor of the country and built a prosperous and powerful socialist nation, going through the tempest of the revolution under the guidance of the great leader and the great party. And it clarifies the idea that any country, small and backward, can turn into a developed and dignified power when it is guided by a great leader and a great party.
					
					 Also expounded in the work are the tasks and ways for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche under the banner of the Juche idea and Songun.

articles.title: "Huichon Speed" Introduced by Mexican Organization
articles.content:
"Huichon Speed" Introduced by Mexican Organization
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea released the 52nd issue of its bulletin captioned "Huichon Speed".
					 The bulletin carried a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il providing field guidance to the construction site of the Huichon Power Station.
					
					 It noted that Kim Jong Il visited the construction site in September last year again and said the construction site witnesses every minute and second a leap forward and innovation and world-startling miracles are being performed one after another thanks to this high degree of enthusiasm. And he called this extraordinary speed "Huichon Speed", it added.
					
					 It is the goal and will of the Koreans to fling open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in the year marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, the bulletin said.
					
					 It cited facts to introduce the noticeable successes achieved by the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and the "Huichon Speed" created in the course of making such achievements, expressing belief that the Korean people would surely fling open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012.

articles.title: Convocatoria del segundo período de sesiones de 12ª legislatura de la APS
articles.content:
Convocatoria del segundo período de sesiones de 12ª legislatura de la APS
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea promulgó el día 18 la resolución sobre la convocatoria de este órgano legislativo.
					Según ella, se convocará el 9 de abril del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche en esta capital el segundo período de sesiones de la duodécima legislatura de la APS.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam realizará la gira por países africanos
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam realizará la gira por países africanos
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, realizará pronto la visita oficial y de amistad a la República de Gabón, la de Senegal y la de Gambia.

articles.title: Minju Joson vuelve a denunciar "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho"
articles.content:
Minju Joson vuelve a denunciar "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho"
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ATCC) -- Los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho", desarrollados bajo la fuerte protesta y denuncia de de todos los connacionales y los pueblos pacifistas del mundo, comprobaron con hechos que EE.UU. y los belicistas surcoreanos usan todos los medios y metodos para realizar su ambicion de agredir a la RPDC.
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este sabado y continua:
					
					Tanto en el numero de los efectivos participantes como en vista del contenido de entrenamiento, "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" son peligrosisimos ejercicios de ataque preventivo nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos trataron de ocultar el caracter agresivo y provocativo de dichas maniobras y de enganar a la opinion publica describiendolas como "defensivas y anuales".
					
					Esos ejercicios militares llevaron la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana al borde de guerra y empeoraron las relaciones RPDC-EE.UU. y las intercoreanas.
					
					"Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" no han dado lugar a la guerra total, lo cual se debe enteramente al disuasivo de guerra de la RPDC para la autodefensa.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea haran todo lo posible en lo adelante tambien por defender la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					EE.UU. y los belicistas titeres surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia dandose cuenta de que nunca se realizara su ambicion de agredir a la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun refuta chismes de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun refuta chismes de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ATCC) -- Al impartir recientemente una conferencia, el ministro de "Reunificacion", Hyon In Thaek, dijo en tono enfatico que la paz inestable de la Peninsula Coreana se debe principalmente al no resuelto "problema nuclear del Norte" y que el Sur de Corea debe "desempenar el papel protagonico en orientar el cambio".
					Con anterioridad, trato de instruir a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el sentido de que esta "se sume" a los esfuerzos de la sociedad internacional por la desnuclearizacion si desea la reunificacion porque el problema nuclear "esta relacionado directamente con la reunificacion traspasando el marco del tema de no proliferacion".
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun publico en su edicion de este sabado un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					Son los mismos titeres surcoreanos los que estan obsesionados por exterminar a los connacionales con las armas nucleares de las fuerzas extranjeras e inestabilizan la situacion librando los ejercicios de guerra nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					A pesar de esta realidad, ellos imputan la responsabilidad a la RPDC segun su logica de bandido.
					
					Los dichos tan absurdos, insultantes y provocativos de la camarilla de conservadores surcoreanos como el traidor Hyon In Thaek, quien con su erronea concepcion de la reunificacion, se atrevio a dar la instruccion arriba referida, parten de la intencion de calumniar, aislar y atropellar a la RPDC.
					
					El pueblo coreano esta muy decepcionado de las acciones vendepatrias de las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas en el poder que tratan de enfrentarse con la connacional RPDC sin ton ni son, lejos de esforzarse mano a mano con ella por la prosperidad nacional.
					
					Es una cosa de morirse de risa que tales tipejos procuraran "orientar" algo.
					
					Mientras los titeres surcoreanos actuen con imprudencia sin conocer lo que son, no tendran nunca el derecho a participar en los dialogos sobre el problema de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Las acciones malevolas deben ser pagadas.
